jparsec.io.image

Class FitsBinaryTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.FitsBinaryTable

  • public class FitsBinaryTable
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to manipulate binary tables in .fits files. One of the main methods contain a program to write fits files that conforms to ALMA Test Interferometer Raw Data Format.

    Please note this class is old and experimental, and several bugs where found in the ALMA specification during its development.

    Byte and complex arrays are not supported.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso-Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • parseHeader

        public static ImageHeaderElement[] parseHeader(java.lang.String[] columns)
        Parses a given set of columns to produce a header.
        Parameters:
        columns - Columns with key + space + format + space + value + space(s) + / + comment. Comment is optional.
        Returns:
        The header.

      • createBinaryTable

        public static nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU createBinaryTable(ImageHeaderElement[] header,
                                      java.lang.String[][] table)
                                               throws nom.tam.fits.FitsException,
                                                      JPARSECException
        Creates an HDU with a binary table.
        Parameters:
        header - The header for the table, excluding parameters that depends on the table. Standard parameters to use are EXTNAME for the name of the table, and TABLEREV for the revision number (format version) of the table.
        table - The table with elements ordered as [rows][columns]. The first row should contain the names for the different columns.
        Returns:
        The HDU.
        Throws:
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - Thrown by nom.tam.fits in case of error initializing a binary table object.
        JPARSECException - In case the header or table contains invalid data.

        public static nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU createAsciiTable(ImageHeaderElement[] header,

                                                     JPARSECException
        Creates an HDU with an Ascii table.
        Parameters:

        table - The table with elements ordered as [rows][columns]. The first row should contain the names for the different columns.
        Returns:
        The HDU.
        Throws:
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - Thrown by nom.tam.fits in case of error initializing a binary table object.
        JPARSECException - In case the header or table contains invalid data.

      • createBinaryTable

        public static nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU createBinaryTable(ImageHeaderElement[] header,
                                      ImageHeaderElement[][] table)
                                               throws nom.tam.fits.FitsException,
                                                      JPARSECException
        Creates an HDU with a binary table.
        Parameters:
        header - The header for the table, excluding parameters that depends on the table. Standard parameters to use are EXTNAME for the name of the table, and TABLEREV for the revision number (format version) of the table.
        table - The table. table.length is the number of rows, and table[0].length the columns for the first row.
        Returns:
        The HDU.
        Throws:
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - Thrown by nom.tam.fits in case of error initializing a binary table object.
        JPARSECException - In case the header or table contains invalid data.

        table - The table. table.length is the number of rows, and table[0].length the columns for the first row.
        Returns:
        The HDU.
        Throws:
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - Thrown by nom.tam.fits in case of error initializing a binary table object.
        JPARSECException - In case the header or table contains invalid data.

      • getBinaryTable

        public static java.lang.String[][] getBinaryTable(nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU bt)
                                           throws JPARSECException,
                                                  nom.tam.fits.FitsException
        Transforms a binary table into a String table containing the names of the columns in the first row, and the data for each row after the first one.
        Parameters:
        bt - The binary table.
        Returns:
        A string table with data as [rows][columns].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the input HDU is not a binary table.
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - In case nom.tam.fits throws an error reading the data.

      • getBinaryTableElement

        public static java.lang.Object getBinaryTableElement(nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU bt,
                                     int row,
                                     int column)
                                              throws JPARSECException,
                                                     nom.tam.fits.FitsException
        Returns the object in the binary table at a specific row and column.
        Parameters:
        bt - The binary table.
        row - The row index.
        column - the column index.
        Returns:
        The object at the specific position.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the input HDU is not a binary table.
        nom.tam.fits.FitsException - In case nom.tam.fits throws an error reading the data.
